front.title: High-level framework for network-based resource sharing

author.organization: Stanford Research Institute (SRI) International, Augmentation Research Center (ARC)

abstract.t: This paper proposes a high-level, application-independent protocol and software framework that would extend the local programming environment to embrace modules in other computers within a resource sharing computer network, and thereby facilitate the construction of distributed systems and encourage the sharing of resources.
The work reported here was supported by the Advanced Research Projects Agency of the Department of Defense, and by the Rome Air Development Center of the Air Force.
This paper has been submitted for publication in the Proceedings of the 1976 National Computer Conference.
